metro.WindowControls

Class ColorBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.WindowControls.ActionObservable
      • metro.WindowControls.ColorBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlElement

    public class ColorBar
extends ActionObservable
implements ControlElement
    A color bar is a stripe of all RGB colors. When the user clicked on this control, the color that has been clicked can be
    Author:
    hauke

        saturation - The saturation of its color.
        brithness - The brightness of its color.

    • Method Detail

      • getClickedColor

        public java.awt.Color getClickedColor()
        Gets the last clicked color of this control. When a user click on it, the color which is under the mouse will be stored.
        Returns:
        The color which has been clicked.

      • setBorderVisibility

        public void setBorderVisibility(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the border.
        Parameters:
        visible - When true, the border will be visible, when false it'll not ;)

      • getHue

        public int getHue(int red,
         int green,
         int blue)
        Calculates the hue-value of the given rgb-values. This implements just one way of calculating this value and there are many other ways but this is absolutely sufficient.
        Parameters:
        red - The red-value of the color.
        green - The green-value of the color.
        blue - The blue-value of the color.
        Returns:
        The hue of the color.
